Package fr.sorbonne_u.components.connectors

Interface ConnectorI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ComponentInterface, RequiredCI
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    DataConnectorI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractConnector, AbstractDataConnector, AbstractDataTwoWayConnector, AbstractTwoWayConnector, ActiveDataConnector, CommunicationConnector, DataConnector, DataTwoWayConnector, DynamicComponentCreationConnector, IntercessionConnector, IntrospectionConnector, NodeConnector, ReflectionConnector, RoutingConnector
    public interface ConnectorI
extends RequiredCI
    The interface ConnectorI is the generic interface for connectors that mediate between requiring and offering components.

    Description

    Connectors are objects that are used to connect components through their required, offered and two-way interfaces. A connector first serves as a translator from calls using the required interface to the ones provided by the offered interface. It therefore implements a required interface by calling the corresponding methods in the offered interface. For two-way interfaces, connectors have to forward correctly the calls among the peers.

    Basically, a connector connects a requiring component to an offering one by implementing the requiring interface with methods that call the offering component through its corresponding offered interface. A connector therefore implements a mapping between the required and the offered interfaces. There is no limit to the number of required and offered interfaces that a component may use or implement.

    Invariant

     invariant      true

    Created on : 2011-11-02

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

      throws Exception
        connect a requiring component to a requiring one.

        Contract

         pre    !connected()
 pre    offering != null && requiring != null
 post   connected()
        Parameters:
        offering - in port of the component implementing the offered interface.
        requiring - out port of the component requiring the required interface.

        Exception - to do.
